poem:
Title: Capitol's Morn

In the hush of dawn, Capitol Hill stirs,
Votes ring, like distant chapel bells,
$1.2tn, a call for reprieve –
Under the broad shadow of time's cavernous mouth.
Two-sided coinage, 286 to 134,
A delicate dance of red and blue.
Now, to the Senate takes the burden,
Like a lighthouse, tasked to keep open the harbour,
In the rain-thrum of uncertain hours.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US House passes $1.2tn spending bill hours before shutdown deadline The House voted on Friday to pass a $1.2tn spending package that would fund much of the federal government through September, with just hours left to avert a partial shutdown. The bill now advances to the Senate, which will have to act quickly to keep the government open. The House vote was 286 to 134, with 101 Republicans and 185 Democrats supporting the funding bill.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
